# Google Analytics node

Use the Google Analytics node to automate work in Google Analytics, and integrate Google Analytics with other applications. n8n has built-in support for a wide range of Google Analytics features, including returning reports and user activities.


On this page, you'll find a list of operations the Google Analytics node supports and links to more resources.

/// note | Credentials
Refer to [Google Analytics credentials](/integrations/builtin/credentials/google/index.md) for guidance on setting up authentication. 
///

--8<-- "_snippets/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/ai-tools.md"

## Operations

* Report
    * Get
* User Activity
    * Search

## Templates and examples

<!-- see https://www.notion.so/n8n/Pull-in-templates-for-the-integrations-pages-37c716837b804d30a33b47475f6e3780 -->
[[ templatesWidget(page.title, 'google-analytics') ]]

## Related resources

Refer to [Google Analytics' documentation](https://developers.google.com/analytics){:target=_blank .external-link} for more information about the service.

--8<-- "_snippets/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/operation-not-supported.md"

properties_schema.name: propertyType
properties_schema.description: Google Analytics 4 is the latest version. Universal Analytics is an older version that is not fully functional after the end of June 2023.

properties_schema.name: metricsGA4
properties_schema.description: The quantitative measurements of a report. For example, the metric eventCount is the total number of events. Requests are allowed up to 10 metrics.

values.name: name
values.hint: If expression is specified, name can be any string that you would like
values.description: The name of the metric. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

values.name: expression
values.description: A mathematical expression for derived metrics. For example, the metric Event count per user is eventCount/totalUsers.

values.name: invisible
values.description: Whether a metric is invisible in the report response. If a metric is invisible, the metric will not produce a column in the response, but can be used in metricFilter, orderBys, or a metric expression.

properties_schema.name: dimensionsGA4
properties_schema.description: Dimensions are attributes of your data. For example, the dimension city indicates the city from which an event originates. Dimension values in report responses are strings; for example, the city could be "Paris" or "New York". Requests are allowed up to 9 dimensions.

values.name: name
values.description: The name of the dimension. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

properties_schema.name: returnAll
properties_schema.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit

properties_schema.name: limit
properties_schema.description: Max number of results to return

properties_schema.name: simple
properties_schema.description: Whether to return a simplified version of the response instead of the raw data

options.name: currencyCode
options.description: A currency code in ISO4217 format, such as "AED", "USD", "JPY". If the field is empty, the report uses the property's default currency.

values.name: name
values.description: The name of the dimension. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: Full Match for the Regular Expression
Partial Match for the Regular Expression

values.name: name
values.description: The name of the dimension. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

values.name: values
values.hint: Comma separated list of values. Must be non-empty.

values.name: name
values.description: The name of the dimension. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

values.name: name
values.hint: If expression is specified, name can be any string that you would like
values.description: The name of the metric. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

values.name: name
values.hint: If expression is specified, name can be any string that you would like
values.description: The name of the metric. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: keepEmptyRows
options.description: Whether false or unspecified, each row with all metrics equal to 0 will not be returned. If true, these rows will be returned if they are not separately removed by a filter.

options.name: orderByUI
options.description: Specifies how rows are ordered in the response

values.name: desc
values.description: Whether true, sorts by descending order

values.name: metricName
values.description: Sorts by metric values. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

values.name: desc
values.description: Whether true, sorts by descending order

values.name: dimensionName
values.description: Sorts by metric values. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: Alphanumeric
options.description: Alphanumeric sort by Unicode code point

options.name: Case Insensitive Alphanumeric
options.description: Case insensitive alphanumeric sort by lower case Unicode code point

options.name: Numeric
options.description: Dimension values are converted to numbers before sorting

options.name: returnPropertyQuota
options.description: Whether to return the current state of this Analytics Property's quota. Quota is returned in PropertyQuota.

values.name: name
values.hint: If expression is specified, name can be any string that you would like
values.description: The name of the metric. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

values.name: expression
values.description: Learn more about Google Analytics metric expressions

values.name: formattingType
values.description: Specifies how the metric expression should be formatted

properties_schema.name: dimensionsUA
properties_schema.description: Dimensions are attributes of your data. For example, the dimension ga:city indicates the city, for example, "Paris" or "New York", from which a session originates.

values.name: name
values.description: Name of the dimension to fetch, for example ga:browser. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

properties_schema.name: returnAll
properties_schema.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit

properties_schema.name: limit
properties_schema.description: Max number of results to return

properties_schema.name: simple
properties_schema.description: Whether to return a simplified version of the response instead of the raw data

values.name: name
values.description: Name of the dimension to fetch, for example ga:browser. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

values.name: operator
values.description: Operator to use in combination with value

values.name: expressions
values.description: String or regular expression to match against

options.name: hideTotals
options.description: Whether to hide the total of all metrics for all the matching rows, for every date range

options.name: hideValueRanges
options.description: Whether to hide the minimum and maximum across all matching rows

options.name: includeEmptyRows
options.description: Whether the response exclude rows if all the retrieved metrics are equal to zero

options.name: useResourceQuotas
options.description: Whether to enable resource based quotas

properties_schema.name: viewId
properties_schema.description: The view from Google Analytics. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

properties_schema.name: returnAll
properties_schema.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit

properties_schema.name: limit
properties_schema.description: Max number of results to return
